meanings.definition: Fopping (verb): to move in a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: She was fopping around the room, knocking over chairs and stumbling over her own feet.
meanings.sent2: The toddler was fopping as he tried to walk for the first time.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he couldn't help fopping around like a newborn giraffe.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts to dance gracefully turned into a fopping disaster on the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The clown's exaggerated fopping brought laughter to the audience.

meanings.definition: Fopping (adjective): describing someone who is clumsy or awkward
meanings.sent1: He felt self-conscious about his fopping movements in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The fopping waiter kept dropping plates and spilling drinks.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fopping nature, he always managed to make people smile with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her fopping attempts at playing basketball made her the team's comic relief.
meanings.sent5: The fopping penguin waddled awkwardly across the ice.

meanings.definition: Fopping (noun): the act of moving clumsily or awkwardly
meanings.sent1: His fopping was so noticeable that everyone in the room turned to watch.
meanings.sent2: The cat's fopping knocked over the vase on the table.
meanings.sent3: The comedy sketch involved a lot of exaggerated fopping for comedic effect.
meanings.sent4: The fopping of the dancers added a unique charm to the performance.
meanings.sent5: The fopping of the clown brought joy to the children at the party.
